Message.Msg: The only people in trouble are any fund managers that haven't taken 10-20% off the table. I've documented on this board many (but not all) of the clearly foreseeable competitive risks and macroeconomic risks. Fund managers are getting paid handsomely to be responsible stewards of others' money. Failing to take profits at these absurd valuations with the macroeconomic headwinds we face is grossly negligent. They will find it increasingly difficult to get out and at much lower prices. The sooner they do, the better off they will be. Those that gamble will find this stock cut in half by mid next year...

Message.Title: trying to be courteous to the longs
Message.Msg: If a friend had spinach in his teeth, you would tell him before he embarrassed himself, right? Without being nasty or anything, AMZN is "spinach" in your portfolio. There's no way this ends well for longs who try to ride this out. It's up huge for the year, going from a p/e of 180 to 300+ after last earnings announcement. Cash in. Take profit. This stock isn't going to go up to a p/e of 500. AMZN may be a good company, but the stock is "priced to perfection". If Apple were to offer a $50 in-store credit on iPad mini's for everyone exchanging a Kindle, this stock would be at $200 overnight. Crusty old WMT offers same day shipping and the stock tanks? This stock's price is extremely vulnerable. Facebook now wants to be a part of e-commerce. States want a piece of all the action with their fair share of taxes. At $250, the AMZN world is Unicorns and Rainbows. Is AMZN going out of business? no. Will AMZN keep a p/e of 300? No way! The last thing Cramer said about AMZN was prescient the other night. Something to the effect of "when the anointed ones (i.e. stocks loved by hedgies) fall out of favor, watch out!" Plus Greece and Cyprus are having new difficulties. Spain's woes are being understated and under-reported. War could break between Syria and Turkey, or Iran and Israel, at any time. At its current levels, AMZN will be one of the first stocks sold in a unforeseen market crash. The 3 month upward trendline has clearly been breached. When this stock has a 3% down day, more are likely to follow. (Check out a 1 year chart.) I've also noticed the recent trend toward low volatility in AMZN. If it goes back into the mode of wild swings like in early 2012, we could all be in for a wild ride. My friendly advice, take your profits and look for the next great company.

Message.Title: DRAM $0.64 with $6.5M Market Cap is a Potential Multi-bagger......DRAM and AMD signed an agreement to launch an aggressive campaign to market all editions of AMD's AMD Memory modules for desktops......Per the agreement, DRAM will develop a special edition RAMDisk utility, which will be called AMD Radeon RAMDisk...... AMD Radeon RAMDisk loading times are expected to be 525% higher than those offered by conventional products
Message.Msg: Dataram Corporation (NASDAQ: DRAM) has announced a huge deal with AMD on September 8. 2012 that is sure to take it to the next level in terms of revenues and net income. The stock is completely under the radar and a reason why its 0.2 X sales valuation giving it a $6.5 million market cap. The company is already almost break-even even before the upcoming AMD-related windfall. DRAM has a strong balance sheet with ZERO long tem debt. Per the agreement, DRAM will develop a special edition RAMDisk utility, which will be called AMD Radeon RAMDisk. AMD Radeon RAMDisk loading times are expected to be 525% higher than those offered by conventional products, increasing performance, eliminating bottlenecks and improving the gaming experience on the PC as well as other applications requiring fast processing like complex engineering simulation models. AMD Radeon RAMDisk utility will be available from October to December this year. DRAM develops, manufactures, and markets large capacity memory products primarily used in high performance network servers and workstations worldwide. The company has more than 70 Fortune 100 customers and it’s been in business since 1967. On September 8, 2012 TechNews Science and Technology published the following article about Advanced Micro Devices (NYSE: AMD) plans to launch an aggressive campaign to encourage all editions of its AMD Memory modules for desktops, and to achieve this has made an agreement with Dataram (NASDAQ: DRAM) known developer of memory modules for servers, workstations and desktops, plus other solutions and associated services; agreement that will develop a special edition RAMDisk utility, which will be called AMD Radeon RAMDisk and come free with AMD Memory memory modules. AMD Radeon RAMDisk loading times offer up to 525% higher in games and applications (better than that offered by SSDs), increasing performance, eliminating bottlenecks and improving the gaming experience on the PC. AMD Radeon RAMDisk utility will be available from October to December this year, and although AMD or Dataram gave more details on its operation, we assume that this utility to create a RAM disk to use by way of a fast disk cache, based on the Game and application profiles present in the Catalyst Control Center utility, which comes bundled with graphics cards, motherboards (chipset) and AMD APUs. On September 14, 2012, DRAM stated the following in its fiscal 1Q 2013 earnings report: During this quarter the Company entered into two agreements which we expect will generate growth and profits for Dataram in 2013 and beyond: - An agreement with AMD provides for Dataram to develop and sell AMD licensed and branded versions of its RAMDisk software. AMD’s Radeon RAMDisk will target the gaming enthusiast community. - An agreement with Shoreline Memory Inc. ("Shoreline") and the other with Advanced Micro Devices, Inc. ("AMD") for the purpose of expanding our customer base and product offerings. The Shoreline Agreement provides for Dataram to fulfill 50% of the orders Shoreline receives from its primary customers. Management believes these agreements will provide new revenue sources and expanded markets for the Company's products. Mr. Freeman concluded, “These recent agreements and other new opportunities we are currently pursuing should provide new sources of revenue, profit and growth for Dataram in 2013 and beyond. The experience, knowledge and assets we have gained from our current RAMDisk product, in the development of caching software and in solid state products are building a strong foundation for growth.” DRAM is also an unrecognized cloud play. DRAM makes the XcelaSAN memory/storage family of products for cloud and all other applications. The company recently received $5 million from a Japanese company to allow the non-exclusive right to manufacture products using the XcelaSAN technology. ABOUT DRAM Dataram Corporation (NASDAQ: DRAM), an independent memory manufacturer, develops, manufactures, and markets large capacity memory products primarily used in high performance network servers and workstations worldwide. It offers customized memory solutions for original equipment manufacturers (OEMs) and compatible memory for computers manufactured by various companies. The company also manufactures a line of memory products for Intel and AMD motherboard based servers. In addition, it develops, manufactures, and markets a line of storage caching products. The company sells its memory products to OEMs, distributors, value-added resellers, and end-users. Dataram Corporation was founded in 1967 and is based in Princeton, New Jersey

Message.Title: Beginning of a new downtrend
Message.Msg: Lots of banks issuing Reverse Convertibles and other Derivative Notes that make money for the bank if Amazon (and other high-flying stocks) go DOWN. Amazon is priced for perfection with too many opportunities to go wrong. Again, I love this company in the long run, but the valuation is not justified right now. We're seeing the downtrend begin and the Amazon Press Release Machine is trying to keep the hype up prior to the earnings release-- which will probably be disappointing on a Revenue basis if the economy is any judge. I'd expect this to keep going down. All it takes is one downgrade from one of the nervous analysts or one of the banks ready to profit from their Reverse Convertibles. Then poof. Good luck to all, but long AMZN is not an investment at this level. It's a very risky trade.

Message.Title: The question is not why stock is going down, but why did it go up in the past 2 months
Message.Msg: The company reported a bad qtr and reduced the following qtr numbers. They are now forced to collect sales tax in TX, PA and CA. Soon more states will be added to the list. And there is a good chance amazon will have to collect tax in all states of congress passes one of the three bills within 3 months. You have increased competition from apple and Google. Apple with Ipad mini and Google with Nexus 7 and push of their Google play. There also a rumor that Google will reduce the price on their nexus to 99 and 199 for the larger tablet. It is one thing for amazon to take on borders, B&N or Best buy, but Apple, Google and Walmart are not in the same category.

Message.Title: "Wrong way Skiidady" and Tranny Rang the Bell on Amazon
Message.Msg: "Wrong Way Skiidady" has an impeccable record of plunging on the bullish side just as a stock is topping. It worked with Chipotle, and appears to be working here. The transportation index (the "tranny") also did a wonderful job in pointin g out that the overall market might be vulnerable to at least a correction. Kudos to both Skiidady and the Trannies for calling the top.

Topic.Title: We know AMZN will come back to a new high....

Message.Msg: I think many people has same thought for CSCO and INTC in year 2000. CSCO always can come back to set new high. Ultimately, the fundamental is the key factor for the stock price long term. Just look at CSCO, and INTC now. They have much high profit margin but their growth is small. Today has such high valuation because it still has growth, but only in revenue(not profit). Some day when its growth story is not there. It could go as low as $30 when it's traded at reasonable PE(say 30).

Topic.Title: Bears--watch out for the "dead cat" bounces

Message.Msg: Yo stinky Jr.!!!! You finally caught a break on your AMZN trades. I guess a blind squirrel CAN find an acorn. I'd sell the puts and take the profit quickly, you know how your luck is.........

Amazon has yet to destroy them, despite having an artificial subsidy via uncollected taxes. Now, they are ALL going after Amazon, which has made a massive strategic mistake of overextending itself (the hubris of $1B office complex is a classic example) because it read its own WS malinvestment junkie press clippings and is now actually quite vulnerable. I remember laughing last year as analysts were arguing that Google couldn't survive the multifront war with Apple, Microsoft and Amazon, despite the $50B in cash, $15B in cash flow and huge margins. Not ONE has raised the issue on Amazon yet (which shows you the state of intellectual rigor and honesty on WS), despite it having a few billion in cash and competing simultaneously against Apple ($100B+), Google ($45B+), MSFT ($75B+), ORCL ($30B), WMT ($8B). All of them can afford to sacrifice a little short term profit to cripple Amazon and all of them will.

I wonder if anyone will dissect the logic tree and breakeven on Amazon's 3P sales model... At what point do Amazon's 3P sellers migrate from Amazon (since it is trying to screw them) and head over to eBay? California is going after AMZN for trying to duck taxes on items "fulfilled" by Amazon... Of course, Amazon has assured everyone collecting sales tax doesn't matter, so there no reason that it should be trying to avoid collecting sales tax on the items it fulfills for 3P in California, right?

I forgot to mention the part where Amazon has been consuming cash the past few years and is generating almost no net cash flow -- BEFORE WalMart decided to go all out, before Apple decided to match eBay pricing, before Google and ORCL got aggressive on cloud, before TGT, WMT (and soon BBY) pull the Kindle platform from the stores, driving the need for significantly increased marketing expense as can be seen from the VERY aggressive TV campaign...
